page.title: 06CASTLE BATCH
page.content: Castle Batch is a recreational area which is surrounded on all sides by new housing development.It is used by local residents as a dog walking area and there is a small childrens playground. Castle Batch never had a castle,only a moat.It is large circular earthwork with walls over 5 metres high,a hollow centre and an entrance at the south-west.It was probably built as the tomb to a long-forgotten chieftain,possibly one of the leaders of Worlebury Camp community. There is some evidence to suggest that a gun site or fort once stood on top of the mound.An old map of the Severn coastline at the time when the Spanish Armada was expected shows a fort roughly at the spot we now call Castle Batch.
